metadata.title: CVE-2017-14733 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
ReadRLEImage in coders/rle.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 mishandles RLEheaders that specify too few colors, which allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) viaa crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14733` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-13
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-13
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-13
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-13
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-13
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-13').
